website_summaries.verdict: A sturdy and versatile steamer and pasta cooker set, although you may have to put some time into cleaning it well before use.
pros: Complete set includes an eight-quart stockpot, a pasta insert, a steamer insert, and a glass lid
Lid is made from tempered glass and has a steam vent
Sturdy polished stainless steel construction with an aluminum disc insert for even heating
cons: Some reports that this option comes covered with a gray production residue that is hard to wash off

customer_reviews.title: Great products and customer service, value is unmatched
customer_reviews.text: Love this product, but this happened while steaming vegetables tonight. Hoping that the manufacturer will replace the lid. The representative contacted me thr next morning, the new lid arrived in 2 days.
customer_reviews.author: Dave R.

customer_reviews.title: Lid shattered
customer_reviews.text: The pot works well however this week the lid shattered everywhere and into the food. I’m hoping amazon will send me a replacement lid.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: Love, love, love this pot/cooking system! Makes cooking pasta sooooo easy! No more pouring noodles into a colander in the sink. Just pick up the center pot and it drains the water right into the pot. Couldn't be easier. And the pot is actually very pretty and sturdy. Great price and a great set. Highly recommend. And I will be buying this again as Christmas gifts for some family members.
customer_reviews.author: Everest

customer_reviews.title: The super chintzy wire handles on the steamer insert are just ...
customer_reviews.text: Sorry to say this one is going back right away. The super chintzy wire handles on the steamer insert are just not acceptable. I don't know why they didn't give it the same handles as the other pieces; that would have made this a really nice set. As it is though; I'm not willing to go fishing around in a 270 degree steamy environment to find some thin wires that are barely attached to the pot. (one of the wires came unattached when I removed it from the box originally). Plus the lid doesn't seem to seat well because it gets caught on the stupid wires. Really bad design of an otherwise well made piece of cookware.
customer_reviews.author: Reid D Murray

customer_reviews.title: My wife loves these items and uses it frequently
customer_reviews.text: Before review, please be advised that, on two recent occasions when I was asked by E-mail to review a purchase I got the following message when trying to submit a review "This product currently has limitations on submitting reviews. There can be a number of reasons for this, including unusual reviewing activity." I have contacted Amazon to inquire about this and received no explanation. Are they now screening reviews? As to the review, this set is excellent, well made and replaces a number of other items much to my wife's pleasure. Highly recommend purchase
customer_reviews.author: Cushomba

customer_reviews.title: This pot shed black flecks when I boiled water in ...
customer_reviews.text: This pot shed black flecks when I boiled water in it. Also seemed to not handle heat well, although I only used it on medium heat. The pot would make a clicking noise as it got hot. I was honestly not sure what was going to happen to it as I was cooking!
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: love this!
customer_reviews.text: I love this pot! The stainless is high quality and always so shiny. I use this pretty much every day and it still looks like new. I love the glass lid and some might not like the metal knob because it does get hot BUT I love that you can put the whole pot in the oven without worrying the knob might melt. I use this to make so many different dishes all in this one pot! Get one u will luv it!
customer_reviews.author: Scooch

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY -- GLASS LID EXPLODES
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical about the low reviews when I read and before I bought this item. So it finally happened to me 2 years later. The glass lid exploded! Not sure why, but from all the reviews, this looks like its a consistent issue with this item. Since it's 2 years now, I doubt any replacement will be offered. I threw the lid in the trash before remembering to take a picture. The rest of the pot is very sturdy and I like it, but as for the glass lid, that's a no go.
customer_reviews.author: Vinh Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Water boils over, bad design
customer_reviews.text: 2.5 Stars. While it’s “attractive” enough, it’s terribly designed. It might look like it’s big enough to cook a large portion of pasta however when cooking pasta even just for two, it always boils over and water comes pouring out between the pot and strainer. The mess is even waterier when the lid is on. I can’t return it now (too late) but I wouldn’t buy this product again.
customer_reviews.author: liz7435

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Pot!
customer_reviews.text: Pot is Great! Encapsulated bottom heats evenly, easy to clean. For the money one of the best pots I have bought.
customer_reviews.author: Islander

customer_reviews.title: Everyone Should Own One!
customer_reviews.text: Most of my steamers spit hot water and left a condensed mess on the stove. this steam has the height needed to contain the water and steam and holds enough water that you can avoid burning the pot and giving your veggies that burndt smell also. Love cooking spaghetti now. The stock pot serves as a soup pot also and I really love the versatility. Wish I had one of these years ago!!!
customer_reviews.author: Judith O. Neff

customer_reviews.title: So Fa So Good
customer_reviews.text: I read alot of people had experience the glass top shattered, even though I went ahead and purchased this, I figured maybe the top had went through a drastic temperature difference so when I use it I try not to place the hot top on my cold counter top, so far it works and looks great,I gave it 5 Stars but If for some reason the glass shatters without the extreme temperature difference, I will update my review, I love this product but I'm keeping my fingers crossed 🤞
customer_reviews.author: Daryl

customer_reviews.title: Great product and worth the buy!
customer_reviews.text: Love this purchase, as I love to make dumplings and putting them on the steamer when I am prepping chicken soup. Wonderful for making pastas! I had one prior but it was a bit heavy, like how some metals today are lighter in weight and the grade of the metals are smoother than before and yet, very well made. When making pasta I steam broccoli, cauliflower, green beans, and corn on the cob while boiling pasta or after.
customer_reviews.author: Randall Gleckler

customer_reviews.title: Well made and sturdy, works on induction stoves
customer_reviews.text: The only thing I dislike about this pot is that it has a small venting hole on the top that doesn't have a cover. (You can see the metal vent in the picture.) When water begins to boil in it on our induction stove, hot water spits out of the vent, mostly an annoyance and a mess, but could be a danger. It is good to have some way for it to vent, but the single hole isn't it. We've begun putting the lid on it off-kilter so that it won't spit water out of the vent.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Meets all my needs
customer_reviews.text: I have had this pot for several months and find that its versatility is very useful. I like the glass top for watching the pot, and the fact that it is vented. The handles don't get hot, another nice bonus. It fits in my base cabinet pull-out shelf/drawer (the handle is not too high, so doesn't require inverting to get it in the cabinet). It is easy to clean. I may purchase a smaller version to replace another pot of mine. I am very satisfied with this one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not good for cooking pasta
customer_reviews.text: I bought his to cook pasta but it’s not great. Like some other reviewers have said rather than promote circulation the water just bubbles up between the 2 pots and overflows. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Keough

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the momey
customer_reviews.text: The pan spills over once it gets to a boil, and once you put the lid on it made a popping noise like it was going to explode. If you use just the pan without the strainer and lid then it’s fine but then that defeats the whole purpose of this pan. I’m not impress or happy with this product!
customer_reviews.author: Penny Sierakowski

customer_reviews.title: Good luck getting rid of black / grey contaminants
customer_reviews.text: After initial unboxing the unit looked great. I washed with soapy water and grey residue appeared. I dish washed and hand dried and I am not able to get rid of the residue. Ian o or comfortable using this to process my sons food
customer_reviews.author: Keith

customer_reviews.title: Back saver
customer_reviews.text: Works well. Has multi-function capabilities. My wife has a bad back. I fill the pot to her instructions, place it on the stove, she can finish from there.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Brunell

customer_reviews.title: I really like this pot set!
customer_reviews.text: Works great - all pieces fit nicely. Handles seem quite substantial. Solid grade steel - not at all cheap! No discoloration of any kind. Very happy with this purchase so far!
customer_reviews.author: GRF

customer_reviews.title: Awesome buy!
customer_reviews.text: I gave this to my mom as a gift and she loves it so much she gave one to all the aunts and cousins for Christmas.
customer_reviews.author: Patti Freeman

customer_reviews.title: Great steamer! And I see why people dinged the ...
customer_reviews.text: Great steamer! And I see why people dinged the product fo pasta, as there is really only about 4 qts of the 8 qt pot that can be submerged with the larger basket, however, cooking fresh pasta in smaller portions works fabulously!
customer_reviews.author: Sophia Bakun

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware glass lid is faulty
customer_reviews.text: The lid exploded into a million pieces this is an unsafe item the glass is not made to withstand the heat
customer_reviews.author: judi manzi

customer_reviews.title: Steamer pot
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this pot to blanch my fresh peas in. It works great. Very sturdy and has a thinker bottom. This pot is a great addition to my kitchen and will come in handy for many canning seasonings to come.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Kirby

customer_reviews.title: Wish I had purchased larger!
customer_reviews.text: This was exactly was I was looking for for a friend. Works fantastic, in fact so well that we wish I had purchased the larger size.
customer_reviews.author: KLMCats

customer_reviews.title: Strainer Could Go Deeper
customer_reviews.text: This set works as expected, and seems to stay nice and shiny between uses. However, I wish the strainer would fit just a little more deeply into the pot. As it is, I am using it to blanch tomatoes and fruits for canning, but am using the strainer in another pot. I am sure when I use if for cooking large amounts of pasta it will be just fine.
customer_reviews.author: S. Fine

customer_reviews.title: Not going to use this... Dark residue ...
customer_reviews.text: Not going to use this... Dark residue keeps coming off of it... Can't get it off...same as other people... Sending back
customer_reviews.author: Afgh

customer_reviews.title: Good value!
customer_reviews.text: Moved into a new apartment and needed all new kitchenware. Didn't want to spend a fortune on pots and pans but needed a good pasta pan/steamer. This has worked well and is a great product for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Erin R.

customer_reviews.title: Works very well!
customer_reviews.text: I use this pot for pasta and steaming veggies- sometimes at the same time! I also use it to boil potatoes. I love the convenience of tipping the inner pot inside the large pot and letting it sit and drain without having to use a colander or drag the pot to the sink! It holds up very well.
customer_reviews.author: debimustard

customer_reviews.title: Excellent. This is the first pot with steamer baskets ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent. This is the first pot with steamer baskets that I've purchased and I love it. It has become one of my favorite cookware items. I can't believe I was missing out on this in my kitchen for so long. I frequently cook pasta in the bottom while steaming vegetables in the top basket. I've also used it as a two tier steamer. It cleans up beautifully and still looks new. I hope it lasts forever; if not I will undoubtedly purchase it again without hesitation!
customer_reviews.author: Haley M.

customer_reviews.title: Spills over the pot
customer_reviews.text: Can't put enough water in pot for a package of pasta without it spilling over the top.
customer_reviews.author: Jeepgeek

customer_reviews.title: Versatile pot that's great on electric and induction cooktops.
customer_reviews.text: After lengthy research, & use, I love this pasta pot! Good price too. It's so versatile; I use it as a stock pot, a vegetable steamer, for soups, and for pasta. Inaddition to my electric stove, it also works great on my induction cooktop. Very pleased with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: GrandmomBB

customer_reviews.title: Really GREAT Find!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I really loved this stainless steel cook set. The price and quality were fabulous, and its so hard to find this combination in stainless steel cookware and I refuse to use aluminum. The large pot is really great for soups, and I have stored the pot in the fridge for extended periods of time and have never had any rust at all. That is one very important way that I measure the quality of pot/pan. The small colander is very nice for rinsing cooked pasta or rinsing and/or steaming veggies.
customer_reviews.author: Jan

customer_reviews.title: Used for Dying Yarn
customer_reviews.text: I use this pot for dying yarn. It is the perfect size to fit a few skeins while still fitting on my stove top. For dying, the pot must be 100% stainless steel or it will react with your dye bath. So far I have had no problems with it. I also love the 2 strainers attached. I use the large one as a strainer and the small one to steam hand painted skeins. Great value, would definitely purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Rachilia

customer_reviews.title: Excellent multi use stock pot with ultra smooth finish for cleaning
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for general kitchen use. We cook a lot and really needed this more for med size stock than cooking pasta but it does a wonderful job of both. I've used this about 20 times now for various meals with a family of 4 and it was perfect for my needs each time. The finish is super smooth and super easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Razorwoods

customer_reviews.title: Can cook multiple things in it.
customer_reviews.text: Not just for pasta. Steams veggies, fish and boneless chicken.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie

customer_reviews.title: Everyone should have this
customer_reviews.text: Why have I waited to get one? This makes life so easy. Handles do get warm...use mittens.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: loved it
customer_reviews.text: cook with it pasta so far doing an amazing job
customer_reviews.author: Michael Hihinashvilie

customer_reviews.title: and it is emphatically better than my old one
customer_reviews.text: I bought this 4-piece pot to replace one I had bought back in the early 1980's, and it is emphatically better than my old one! Nice heavy stainless pot, pasta cooker and steamer basket, plus a glass lid. Excellent value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Marion Capriotti

customer_reviews.title: Love this item!
customer_reviews.text: Love it! It's great for cooking pasta, corn on the cob, steaming vegetables, etc. My parents are even requesting one for Christmas after seeing it when they were over for dinner one night. Very versatile item for the kitchen!
customer_reviews.author: PrimeShopper

customer_reviews.title: It is a good pot and steamer for the price
customer_reviews.text: It is a good pot and steamer for the price. Only complaint so far is that the pasta strainer sits a little to far from the bottom of the pot. The pot is slightly wider than the average stock pot of the same fluid capacity, but when adding 16 oz of pasta when it is full of water will cause overflow from the sides of the pot in between the pasta strainer and the pot. For small amounts of pasta this item is perfect but if you are going to be making more than 12oz of pasta I would opt for a taller combo
customer_reviews.author: matthew

customer_reviews.title: Great pot for tamale cooking!
customer_reviews.text: I love my new pots it makes my tamale cooking really great!! I can cook two dozen easily and the fact that the water stays on bottom makes the steaming of the tamales a breeze!!
customer_reviews.author: Narci Castillo

customer_reviews.title: Soups, stews and stocks
customer_reviews.text: I need a slightly larger pot than what came with my pots and pans. It has a good weight, thick bottom and it nearly holds a 18lb turkey carcass.
customer_reviews.author: Bike Commuter

customer_reviews.title: Well Made, great buy!
customer_reviews.text: This is a good steamer pot. Works great for pasta of course and great for tamales. It does a dozen tamales without a problem. It's well constructed and appears to be durable. It gets a lot of use and it is holding up fine so far. Great buy.
customer_reviews.author: AMAZADDICT

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for for the money spent
customer_reviews.text: as advertised. shipped on time. light weight not very well made on the strainer holes but good for the price. If you're expecting top of the line restaurant quality you wouldn't be shopping for a $30.00 steamer... I would say it is a good buy for the money spent.
customer_reviews.author: Candice Little

customer_reviews.title: I havent had any issues
customer_reviews.text: Some people have had issues with theirs but I've never had an issue. I was worried at first because I did see pics of peoples kids cracking during steaming but luckily that hasn't happened.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha JM

customer_reviews.title: I've always wanted one
customer_reviews.text: I've always wanted one of these pasta pots where you just lift it out of the water instead of trying to drain into a colander, but they can be very expensive. This one has been fantastic. It's light enough to handle with ease and is easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: SB in CA

customer_reviews.title: Below Average
customer_reviews.text: The product is sturdy. However, it takes awhile for this pot to boil especially if you're using the inserts for pasta. I also don't think the lid cover completely covers the pot as bits of the steam spews out from under the cover and land on the floor. Pasta insert is not very useful since it takes so long for the pot to boil and the pot doesn't hold nearly as much pasta once the insert is involved.
customer_reviews.author: CT

customer_reviews.title: Every family needs this !
customer_reviews.text: Arrived quickly and as described.. This was a gift to someone else and she loved it !
customer_reviews.author: Taps-Wife

customer_reviews.title: Nice pot but a bit large.
customer_reviews.text: This is a good pot but it is kind of bulky for cooking smaller amounts of pasta. In addition, I have experienced the staining on the bottom of the pot as others reviewers have.
customer_reviews.author: Hawkeye45

customer_reviews.title: Fails at its most basic function
customer_reviews.text: While the quality of the pot is commensurate to its price, it fails at its most basic function; cooking pasta! The moment the water returns to a boil after putting the pasta in, water consistently spills out and floods the stove. I have tried to reduce the water level, but it makes no difference.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Jenny

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality, especially for the price!
customer_reviews.text: My old "spaghetti pot" was starting to loose the enamel lining and this one more than replaces the old one. In fact, I wish I had found this one sooner! Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Nan2

customer_reviews.title: A must have if you like to eat pasta
customer_reviews.text: Basically, if you don't have a pasta pot, you're running on three (out of four) cylinders. It's a good quality pot and makes the final prep a lot more efficient.
customer_reviews.author: Guy Page

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful cookware
customer_reviews.text: it came well-packaged, and was shiny and beautiful. It had no stickers to peel off. I just needed to rinse it in warm sudsy water and get started. It works well.
customer_reviews.author: H. Rodriguez James

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful cookware
customer_reviews.text: This is the second set I have bought! I loved the first so much I gave a set to my son and daughter in law .
customer_reviews.author: Katrina Kjellstrom

customer_reviews.title: Overflow design problem
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy pot but it would be wise of everyone to read the past reviews about the way it is designed. The insert causes water to overflow and it is a mess. I wish I had read them before purchasing
customer_reviews.author: TreetopNTn

customer_reviews.title: What a deal!
customer_reviews.text: Cannot believe the quality of this set for the price! If you need a pot like this, look no further!
customer_reviews.author: B. Guatta

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price steamer and pasta cooker
customer_reviews.text: I love that it came with 3 pieces. I use them all. However, the pot itself cannot be used for anything other than boiling water and steaming. It will change color because it can't handle the very high temperatures.
customer_reviews.author: A Prime

customer_reviews.title: pasta pot
customer_reviews.text: wish it was dishwasher compatible but instructions say wash by hand to maintain the finish
customer_reviews.author: Sharon V. Dawson

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for pasta
customer_reviews.text: Love how easy it easy to use this for pasta, but also can be used for soup.
customer_reviews.author: HoneyBee

customer_reviews.title: Pasta cooker
customer_reviews.text: I think this makes it safer to make pasta as you don't have to worry about the pot slipping when draining the pasta. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Hopkins

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Well made, works great, but I should have brought a larger pot.
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: Love this set it’s the perfect size and so easy to clean! Definitely recommend it to everyone!
customer_reviews.author: Mary Saddler

customer_reviews.title: This is a fantastic rugged pot set
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic rugged pot set, we use it about 4 or 5 times a week to steam veggies in the small insert.. Cooking mussels has never been easier, because you can saute onions in the base pot while making sure the mussels are clean, then put them in the insert. When they are done you can just lift out the insert to get the broth.
customer_reviews.author: Terlbear

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice
customer_reviews.text: Very nice. Well made medium gage mirror finished stainless steel. A little expensive....but well worth it. You won' t do better than this ay any price. Should last a lifetime. Quick shipping and well packaged. It's a winner.
customer_reviews.author: Herb from WA

customer_reviews.title: Quality item
customer_reviews.text: So many ways to use these pots. Very versatile. Well made.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny

customer_reviews.title: This is a great steamer and pasta cooker
customer_reviews.text: This is a great steamer and pasta cooker. We have not used the pasta part as yet, but the steamer several times. It is plenty roomy for lots of vegetables.
customer_reviews.author: Merrymae

customer_reviews.title: Do not fill above strainer holes.
customer_reviews.text: The only problem with this pot is it sits better than an inch from the bottom and the drain hole are not high enough so water spits out the sides.
customer_reviews.author: J05H13

customer_reviews.title: Best Amazon purchase
customer_reviews.text: This was a steal!! One of my best purchase on Amazon. This stock pot is solid in wieght and absolutely beautiful. My husband thought it was a very expensive brand. Loving it
customer_reviews.author: LeeAnn Russell

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: How smart this set is. 8-Qts is the perfect size.
customer_reviews.author: RCH

customer_reviews.title: Easy
customer_reviews.text: Can use this for many things. Happy to have it
customer_reviews.author: Jan Derrick

customer_reviews.title: great buy
customer_reviews.text: great pasta pot for the money...wish I had replaced my old aluminum one years ago...recommend it highly for pasta and steaming
customer_reviews.author: value seeker

customer_reviews.title: New favorite kitchen item
customer_reviews.text: I love the pot and strainer. My only complaint is that when the strainer cooks in the pot that there is too much excess water between the actual pot and the strainer so the water boils over quite a bit. Other than that, I have zero complaints and I enjoy cooking with this!
customer_reviews.author: Tara Stimpson

customer_reviews.title: Love this pot!
customer_reviews.text: This is a perfect buy! The price is right, the pot is weighty not cheaply made. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl Longo

customer_reviews.title: I love the usefulness of this
customer_reviews.text: I love the usefulness of this. Mostly I use it for making stocks. I appreciate that it is safe for me to be able to use on our wood stove for a slow cook
customer_reviews.author: P Sikes

customer_reviews.title: Nice pot
customer_reviews.text: I like that I can steam vegetables and cook pasta at the same time.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Petty

customer_reviews.title: The problem is that the boiling water very easily climbs up the space between the strainer and the ...
customer_reviews.text: This product has an unfortunate tendency to spill boiling water all over my stove. The problem is that the boiling water very easily climbs up the space between the strainer and the pan wall. To compensate, I've found that I must use a minimal volume of water, barely covering whatever food I'm trying to boil. Even that isn't always enough.
customer_reviews.author: tophercer

customer_reviews.title: Good enough quality at a good price
customer_reviews.text: I'm very pleased with the overall quality of materials and construction. I'm always hesitant with cheaper product options because quality does often lack, but I can happily report this product not to be poor.
customer_reviews.author: Parents of 3

customer_reviews.title: Love this set!
customer_reviews.text: Good quality. The food does not stick to the bottom, even when I over cook anything. I love the inner parts, you can cook veggies by steam.
customer_reviews.author: JULIANA

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great cook set. Very effective for steaming seafood. Great size for corn on cobs .
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Too big for me; excellent quality!
customer_reviews.text: Very well made, but didn’t realize how large 8 quart pot is! Heavy if full to move from stove to sink to drain!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Austin

customer_reviews.title: Pasta takes a while, but nice set!
customer_reviews.text: The pasta basket is a little too small so you need to use a LOT of water to get up to it (maybe that's the "proper" way to cook spaghetti?), and the holes are a little small, but I've still successfully cooked angel hair pasta in it. Functional, handy set of tools.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Dougherty

customer_reviews.title: I highly recommend this product
customer_reviews.text: They call this a pasta pot but you can as do I find many many uses got it. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: G. Halley

customer_reviews.title: Great quality pasta pot
customer_reviews.text: This is a really sturdy and great quality pasta pot. It is a great price and I was very happy with the product. I highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: The 4 piece is super. Definitely worth the price
customer_reviews.text: I always wanted one of these rather than using misc pots and colanders. The 4 piece is super. Definitely worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: A M C

customer_reviews.title: Happy I purchased this!
customer_reviews.text: This steamer worked so perfectly for all the canning I did this summer. Makes blanching the veggies so easy!!
customer_reviews.author: Debbie

customer_reviews.title: Want one this size for a long time
customer_reviews.text: Big enough to hold a big batch of vegetable soup but not so big that the leftovers don't fit in the fridge.
customer_reviews.author: Lewis Craig Brown

customer_reviews.title: Pasta strainer makes a mess
customer_reviews.text: The built-in pasta drainer doesn’t work without water spitting out the side and spraying all over the stove top. I will continue to use the pot as just a stock pot but I bought it to strain pasta
customer_reviews.author: Carol A Coats

customer_reviews.title: Useful
customer_reviews.text: Good and useful product that was delivered in excellent shape.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love this! We cook our pasta in it
customer_reviews.text: I love this! We cook our pasta in it, steam veggies, make soups, you name it! This pot is amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Savannah

customer_reviews.title: steamer handles are useless
customer_reviews.text: Works nicely on my Induction Cooktop. It's nice to have 2 inserts. However, the steamer handles are lousy. They are wire handles, and they fell out immediately.
customer_reviews.author: MKR

customer_reviews.title: Nice mid-size, versatile, quality.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size for so many uses. Very nicely made, pieces nest very well.
customer_reviews.author: DTL

customer_reviews.title: Really nice. Looking forward to steaming Tamales and fixing Spaghetti ...
customer_reviews.text: Really nice. Looking forward to steaming Tamales and fixing Spaghetti and Linguine
customer_reviews.author: Ray S.

customer_reviews.title: Nice quality pot.
customer_reviews.text: A great item, worked really well and I'm very happy I purchased it.
customer_reviews.author: J. M. C.

customer_reviews.title: I bought this set for my son who recently moved ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this set for my son who recently moved out on his own and loves to cook. He says he loves them. They were priced very reasonably and had free two-day shipping with my Prime membership, shipped directly to him.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Huge Time Saver
customer_reviews.text: Allows me to cook multiple things at once. Other reviews are correct that water does boil up at the sides, but overall it’s perfect for all the multitasking required to get dinner on the table with minimal dishes to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice set, don't let the price fool you. I'm using it several times a week. It is large enough that I usually don't have to stir the vegetables that I am steaming. They come out perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality
customer_reviews.text: The pasta cooker was better than I had expected; the quality of construction was excellent.I appreciate the heavier bottom than other types have.The metal handles for the small steamer are awkward, but serviceable. I am very pleased with this purchase offered at a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Hamiter

customer_reviews.title: Needs a better design
customer_reviews.text: The holder for the lid comes off, which makes it impossible to lift it with food in it.
customer_reviews.author: U. D.

customer_reviews.title: Very good quality for a low price
customer_reviews.text: The set I received had the proper handle and stainless steel screw on top, unlike what others have mentioned. I'm entirely happy with the set and highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Johnnie E McBride

product_meta.title: Cook N Home, Stainless Steel 4-Piece 8 Quart Pasta Cooker Steamer Multipots
product_meta.description: Style:8QTThe Cook N Home 4-piece 8 quart pasta cooker steamer multipots, stainless steel includes an 8 quart stockpot, steamer insert, pasta insert-pot, and a tempered glass lid. Made of polished stainless steel with an encapsulated aluminum bottom for even heat distribution. Induction compatible. The Cook N Home 4-Piece 8 Quart Pasta Cooker Steamer Multipots, Stainless Steel includes an 8 quart stockpot, steamer insert, pasta insert/pot, and a tempered glass lid. Made of polished stainless steel with an encapsulated aluminum bottom for even heat distribution. Riveted handles for durability and tempered glass lid with steam vent to view food. Deep steamer insert can hold a large amount of vegetables, proteins, etc. Pasta pot can cook a variety of noodles and can be used as a strainer. Induction compatible. Works on gas, electric, glass, ceramic, halogen, etc. Dishwasher safe.
feature_bullets: Includes: 8 quart stockpot, steamer insert, pasta insert/pot, and a tempered glass lid
Stainless steel with an aluminum disc layered in the bottom for even heat distribution
Tempered glass lid with steam vent to view food; Durable stainless steel riveted handles
Deep steamer insert holds a large amount; Pasta pot/strainer cooks a variety of noodles
Works on Induction, gas, electric, glass, ceramic, halogen, etc.; Dishwasher safe
